com.github.nsc.de.compiler.lexer.characterinputstream

Interface CharacterInputStream

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StringCharacterInputStream

    public interface CharacterInputStream
    A CharacterInputStream provides the characters for the Lexer
    Author:
    Nicolas Schmidt <@nsc-de>
    See Also:
    StringCharacterInputStream

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char actual()
      Returns the actual character (the same as returned by next() when used before)
      char[] getContent()
      Returns the chars of the CharacterInputStream
      Position getPosition()
      Returns the actual position of the CharacterInputStream
      String getSource()
      Returns the source (mostly file) of the CharacterInputStream
      boolean has(int number)
      Checks if the CharacterInputStream has a given number of characters left
      boolean hasNext()
      Checks if the CharacterInputStream has a next character left
      char next()
      Returns the next character and continues to the next token
      default char peek()
      Gives back the next character without skipping
      char peek(int num)
      Gives back a character of the CharacterInputStream (relative to the actual position)
      String peek(int from, int to)
      Gives back a part of the CharacterInputStream as string (relative to the actual position)
      void skip()
      Skips the next character
      void skip(int number)
      Skips a given number of characters

        Gives back the next character without skipping

      • peek

        char peek(int num)
        Gives back a character of the CharacterInputStream (relative to the actual position)
        Parameters:
        num - the position to get
        Returns:
        the character at the requested position

      • peek

        String peek(int from,
            int to)
        Gives back a part of the CharacterInputStream as string (relative to the actual position)
        Parameters:
        from - the starting position of the string to get
        to - the end position of the string to get
        Returns:
        the character at the requested position
